meanings.sent1: The unexpected lisk of the car startled me.
meanings.sent2: I felt a lisk in my arm when I slipped on the ice.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a little lisk as it pounced on the toy.
meanings.sent4: His heart gave a lisk of excitement when he saw the surprise.
meanings.sent5: The lisk of the branch breaking echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden movement or jerk.
meanings.sent1: She tried to lisk away from the spider crawling towards her.
meanings.sent2: The horse will lisk if you suddenly pull on the reins.
meanings.sent3: He will lisk in surprise when he sees the birthday cake.
meanings.sent4: The dancer will lisk across the stage with grace and agility.
meanings.sent5: The child will lisk with joy when he opens his present.

meanings.definition: A small, sharp or hard object.
meanings.sent1: She found a lisk of glass in her shoe.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a lisk of garlic to the sauce for flavor.
meanings.sent3: The detective discovered a hidden lisk in the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: The artist used a lisk of charcoal to add detail to the drawing.
meanings.sent5: The hiker felt a lisk of rock under his foot as he climbed the mountain.
